reviewText: Classic Mexican Cinema at it's best.
Terrific movies from the Mexican Golden Age!
I think it is a beautiful movie. Even if the  director has been considered a minor one. Often the same happened to other directors.

I like old movies, Mexican movie are rare to get, my mother has been asking me to buy them for her, she is really enjoying them and for the price can beat it. She is creating her own library of old Spanish movies and novelas.

Mercedes Gmez (Lpez) is a beautiful prostitute pimped by handsome Paco (Rodolfo Acosta) and secretly loved by the neighborhood's policeman Lupe (Miguel Incln). She has a secret (and a reason to do what she does, since that's probably the fastest way to get the money she need to keep her little sister in School, for a better future unlike her own). Little sister Beatriz (Silvia Derbez) attends a Private School and she dreams of becoming something big in life.

This story follows Mercedes' life, dark and saddened by her circumstances, her desperation and anguish knowing that she could never be able to reciprocate Lupe's honest love since she is tainted, while Paco keeps stealing and hitting her trying to get more and more from her.

Emilio ''indio'' Fernndez did a great job here, through Figueroa's lens and supported by a very good script (by Mauricio Magdaleno and himself, based on the musical composition by Aaron Copeland-which by the way is also beautiful) and a great cast. I can feel what's going on on the screen as if I was there with them... sublime!
This is one of my all time favorites movies, I received it on time and as promised, it's a classic and it's totally worth the money
